Package pgui.win

Class Window

java.lang.Object
pgui.type.Element
pgui.win.Window
Direct Known Subclasses:
ScrollWindow
public class Window extends Element
A Window is a class that contains a collection of 'elements' - other interface objects, such as buttons, text or other windows.
Author:
Jack Humphreys
See Also:
  • Element

      public int x
      The position of the top left corner of the window on the parent PGraphics object. Set to 0 by default.

      public int y
      The position of the top left corner of the window on the parent PGraphics object. Set to 0 by default.

    • Window

      public Window(processing.core.PApplet sketch, Palette colours)
      Used for main windows, with no parent window.
      Parameters:
      sketch - A reference to the Processing sketch - use keyword 'this'
      colours - The Window's colour palette

    • Window

      public Window(Palette colours, Window parent)
      Used for sub-windows.
      Parameters:
      colours - The Window's colour palette
      parent - The parent window within which the current window belongs to

    • addButton

      public Button addButton(String methodName, Object[] methodArgs, Object instance, String label, float btnx, float btny, float Width, float Height)
      Adds a Button to the Window.
      Parameters:
      methodName - The name of the method the Button will invoke
      methodArgs - The parameters to be passed to the Button's activation method
      instance - An instance of the Class the method belongs to. Use keyword 'this' if the method is defined within the Processing Editor without a class.
      label - The Button's label - Button.label
      btnx - The position of the Button's top left corner relative to the Window
      btny - The position of the Button's top left corner relative to the Window
      Width - The Button's width - Button.Width
      Height - The Button's height - Button.Height
      Returns:
      The created Button.

    • addText

      public Text addText(String text, float tx, float ty, int size)
      Adds a Text object to the Window.
      Parameters:
      text - The string to be displayed.
      tx - x position relative to Window
      ty - y position relative to Window
      size - Text size
      Returns:
      The created Text object.
      See Also:
      • Text.align(int, int)

    • addSlider

      public Slider addSlider(float min, float max, float sx, float sy, float length)
      Adds a Slider to the Window.
      Parameters:
      min - Minimum slider value
      max - Maximum slider value
      sx - Centre x position relative to Window
      sy - Centre y position relative to Window
      length - Length of slider
      Returns:
      The created Slider object.
      See Also:
      • Slider.setAxis(char, int)

    • addScrollWindow

      public ScrollWindow addScrollWindow(Palette colours, int swx, int swy, int Width, int Height, int contentHeight)
      Adds a ScrollWindow to the Window.
      Parameters:
      colours - The colour palette for the ScrollWindow
      swx - The x position of top left corner relative to parent Window
      swy - The y position of top left corner relative to parent Window
      Width -
      Height -
      contentHeight - The vertical length of the scroll canvas
      Returns:
      The created ScrollWindow object.

    • addSwitch

      public Switch addSwitch(float cx, float cy, float Width, float Height)
      Adds a toggle switch to the Window.
      Parameters:
      cx - Centre x relative to Window
      cy - Centre y relative to Window
      Width -
      Height -
      Returns:
      The created switch object.

    • addRadioButtonGroup

      public RadioButtonGroup addRadioButtonGroup(float x, float y, float r, float spacing, String[] labels)
      Adds a group of radio buttons to the Window.
      Parameters:
      x - x-coordinate of the centre of the first button
      y - y-coordinate of the centre of the first button
      r - Radius of each button
      spacing - Distance between each button
      labels - An array containing each RadioButton's label
      Returns:
      The create RadioButtonGroup object.

    • addContent

      public Method addContent(String mName, Object[] args, Object classInstance)
      Provide the appropriate visual function(s) the window should display by adding a method to the window
      Parameters:
      mName - Name of visual method
      args - Method arguments
      classInstance - Instance of parent class of method
      Returns:
      The visual method
